title: Air raid sirens sound across Israel following Iranian missile attack
byline: (UPDATED) Iran’s state news agency reported that Iran has fired hundreds of ballistic missiles toward Israel as part of its retaliation for Israel’s Friday attack on Iranian nuclear and military sites. MOLRE..

title: Heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers will occur at times in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, Southern, and North-western provinces.

title: One access road to Sripada closed for 10 days - RDA
byline: The Road Development Authority (RDA) has announced that the road from Norton Bridge to Sripada via Ginigathhena and Diyagala will be closed for a period of 10 days due to urgent maintenance work.

title: Iran strikes back at Israel with missiles over Jerusalem, Tel Aviv
byline: Iran launched retaliatory airstrikes at Israel on Friday night, with explosions heard in Jerusalem and Tel Aviv, the country’s two largest cities, following Israel’s biggest-ever military strike against its longstanding enemy.

title: India extends funding to ferry service linking Sri Lanka
byline: India has decided to extend the LKR 300 million financial assistance for another year to support the passenger ferry service between Kankesanthurai in Sri Lanka‘s north and Nagapattinam in Tamil Nadu.

title: Severe drug shortages in hospitals, including cancer medications - GMOA
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has reported a shortage of several essential medicines, including painkillers, antibiotics, and medications for high blood pressure, diabetes, and kidney diseases.

title: India urges Iran and Israel to avoid escalation, emphasises dialogue and diplomacy
byline: India on Friday expressed deep concern over the recent developments between Iran and Israel and called for restraint from both sides, according to a statement by the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA).

title: Google, Scale AI’s largest customer, plans split after Meta deal
byline: Alphabet’s Google, the largest customer of Scale AI, plans to cut ties with Scale after news broke that rival Meta is taking a 49% stake in the AI data-labeling startup, five sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

title: Burnt body of police officer found inside three-wheeler in Negombo
byline: A charred body, identified as that of a police officer, was discovered inside a three-wheeler on the Kochchikade Kammal Thotupola seashore in Negombo this morning (14), police said.

title: Sri Lankan Ambassador updates on Iran–Israel tensions: No Sri Lankan casualties
byline: Sri Lanka’s Ambassador to Israel, Nimal Bandara, has confirmed that Iran has launched multiple ballistic missile attacks targeting areas near Tel Aviv and Jerusalem, amid the ongoing escalation of hostilities between Iran and Israel.

title: Acting Defence Minister inspects Turkish naval ship ‘TCG Büyükada’
byline: Acting Minister of Defence, Major General Aruna Jayasekara (Retd), inspected the Turkish Navy ship TCG Büyükada, which arrived in Sri Lanka on an official visit yesterday (13 June).

title: KKS police station receives anonymous threat call
byline: The Kankesanthurai Police Station has reportedly received an anonymous phone call alleging that around 10 police stations in the Northern Province would come under attack.

title: President Anura Kumara meets Sri Lankan community in Germany
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, currently on an official visit to Germany, met with members of the Sri Lankan community residing in the country last afternoon (13).

title: ‘No power, no thrust:’ Air India pilot’s 5-second distress call to Ahmedabad ATC emerges
byline: Two days after the Air India disaster in Ahmedabad, an audio has emerged revealing the pilots’ final message to the Air Traffic Control (ATC) moments before the flight crashed into the medical college building.

title: Emergency contact details announced for Sri Lankans in Israel and Iran
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Foreign Employment has announced that the Government of Sri Lanka is closely monitoring the evolving military situation between Israel and Iran.

title: ‘Red’ warning issued for strong winds and rough seas
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a ‘Red’ warning for strong winds and rough seas.

title: South Africa script history, crowned world Test champions
byline: Following decades of falling agonisingly short of success, South African cricket has finally achieved a historic first major triumph with a 5 wicket victory over Australia to win the World Test Championship at Lord’s on Saturday.

title: Landslide warnings issued for several areas in 7 districts
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has issued early landslide warnings for multiple areas in seven districts as heavy rainfall continues in parts of the island.

title: Pulp score first UK no. 1 album in 27 years
byline: British band Pulp returned to the top of the UK album charts for the first time in 27 years on Friday as their new record “More” went to No. 1.

title: US lawmaker killed and another wounded in ‘politically motivated’ attacks
byline: A Minnesota state representative and her husband were shot and killed, and a state senator and his wife were shot and wounded in an “act of targeted political violence” at their homes early Saturday, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz said.

title: Death toll rises to 279 in India plane crash
byline: At least 279 people died in the plane crash in the Indian city of Ahmedabad, making it the world’s deadliest air disaster since 2014, according to a new toll released Saturday.

title: 378 acting sub-postmasters to receive permanent appointments
byline: A total of 378 Acting Sub-Postmasters are scheduled to be granted permanent appointments tomorrow (15), under the patronage of the Minister of Health and Mass Media, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa.

title: Thousands gather to welcome Thailand’s first Miss World, Opal Chuangsri
byline: Thailand’s Opal Suchata Chuangsri scripted history after she became the first ever beauty queen from her country to win the Miss World crown.
